author: TravisEz13
body:
<!--

If you are running a released version of powershell, but not the latest one, install the latest from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases and try to repro it again

Before submitting this issue, please first:

- [ ] Search the existing issues.
- [ ] Refer to the [FAQ](../docs/FAQ.md).
- [ ] Refer to the [known issues](../docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- [ ] If it is a bug, fill out this form:
-->
## Steps to reproduce

`update-help -Module microsoft.powershell.management -force`
## Expected behavior

it should update help
## Actual behavior

```
update-help : Failed to update Help for the module(s) 'Microsoft.PowerShell.Management' with UI culture(s) {en-US} :
The method or operation is not implemented.
At line:1 char:1
+ update-help -Module microsoft.powershell.management -force
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : InvalidOperation: (:) [Update-Help], Exception
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : UnknownErrorId,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.UpdateHelpCommand
```
## Environment data

verified using Start-DevPSGitHub -binDir D:\v0.5.0-101-g06e3608\
a master-sd build on nano

<!-- If running the latest released version, specify the version, i.e. -->

v0.4.0

<!-- If running you own build, please fill in the results of the following commands: -->

``` powershell
> $PSVersionTable

```

``` sh
$ dotnet --info


$ git rev-parse HEAD; git status


```

comments.author: adityapatwardhan
comments.body: @TravisEz13  Can you try that again, there was an issue in the published help content. This was fixed on Friday, can you check if this is still a case?

title: Update-help fails for windows builds
